meaning_english: Highly skilled or proficient in something. Synonyms: Skilled, Expert, Proficient, Competent.
A difficult or unpleasant situation. Synonyms: Hardship, Misfortune, Calamity, Distress.
To make something less severe. Synonyms: Relieve, Reduce, Mitigate, Ease.
Having more than one meaning; unclear. Synonyms: Vague, Obscure, Unclear, Doubtful.
More than enough; plentiful. Synonyms: Abundant, Sufficient, Plentiful, Adequate.
Very difficult and tiring. Synonyms: Tough, Laborious, Strenuous, Hard.
To state something confidently. Synonyms: Declare, Affirm, Claim, Maintain.
Well meaning and kindly. Synonyms: Kind, Generous, Charitable, Humane.
Truthful and straightforward. Synonyms: Honest, Frank, Sincere, Open.
Logical and well organized. Synonyms: Logical, Consistent, Clear, Connected.
Hardworking and careful. Synonyms: Industrious, Assiduous, Persistent, Dedicated.
Detailed and carefully developed. Synonyms: Detailed, Comprehensive, Thorough, Extensive.
To give special importance to something. Synonyms: Highlight, Stress, Underscore, Accentuate.
Incorrect or wrong. Synonyms: Wrong, False, Inaccurate, Mistaken.
Possible to do easily. Synonyms: Practical, Achievable, Workable, Viable.
Easily broken or damaged. Synonyms: Delicate, Brittle, Frail, Weak.
About to happen very soon. Synonyms: Impending, Approaching, Forthcoming, Near.
Certain to happen; unavoidable. Synonyms: Unavoidable, Inescapable, Certain, Sure.
Very careful and precise. Synonyms: Careful, Precise, Thorough, Exact.
No longer in use; outdated. Synonyms: Outdated, Archaic, Deprecated, Old-fashioned.
